alert.note: Alert for Emanuel; Jefferson; Johnson; Laurens; Montgomery; Telfair; Toombs; Treutlen; Wheeler (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 05 at 4:47PM EDT until April 05 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Eastern Laurens County in central Georgia... Emanuel County in east central Georgia... Northern Toombs County in southeastern Georgia... Central Telfair County in central Georgia... Treutlen County in east central Georgia... Johnson County in east central Georgia... Wheeler County in central Georgia... Southeastern Jefferson County in east central Georgia... Montgomery County in central Georgia... * Until 530 PM EDT. * At 446 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Donovan to Lowery to near China Hill, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Swainsboro, McRae, Lyons, Soperton, Alamo, Mount Vernon, Wrightsville, Vidalia, Helena, Wadley, Twin City, Glenwood, Adrian, Stillmore, Oak Park, Ailey, Scotland, Higgston, Garfield and Santa Claus. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for central, southeastern and east central Georgia. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. If you see wind damage...hail or flooding...wait until the storm has passed...and then call the National Weather Service toll free at 1 8 6 6 7 6 3 4 4 6 6 or tweet us your report at NWSATLANTA.

area.areaDesc: Emanuel; Jefferson; Johnson; Laurens; Montgomery; Telfair; Toombs; Treutlen; Wheeler
